snippet: Gov. Rick Snyder on Tuesday agreed to end Detroit’s status as a city in financial emergency and to send home the emergency manager he appointed in March 2013 to oversee the city through its crisis.
abstract: Michigan Gov Rick Snyder announces he will end Detroit's status as city in financial crisis, saying court-approved bankruptcy plan and new budget have put city on footing to meet its obligations.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Snyder on Tuesday agreed to end Detroit’s status as a city in financial emergency and to send home the emergency manager he appointed in March 2013 to oversee the city through its crisis.
